pros: too many here as its great
cons: zero cons in my view as a producer

pros: A great place for someone new to media and who wants to learn at an entry level
cons: Upper management is intimidated by anyone with actual experience outside of MNN, and will go to great lengths to protect their hierarchy. A very difficult place to get promoted, it's an unsatisfying experience if you have ambition and creativity really isn't rewarded. The people who work the hardest are wildly underpaid.
advice_to_mgmt: Stop looking down on your employees

cons: No room for growth, inexperienced management and poor media skills from upper management. Micromanaging

review_title: Run!!!!! Run, FAR AWAY IF YOU WANT A CAREER IN MEDIA!!!!
years_at_company: Run!!!!! Run, FAR AWAY IF YOU WANT A CAREER IN MEDIA!!!!
pros:
-A good place to get your feet wet.
-Some coworkers are pretty great!
cons:
-HR policies are ridiculous and HR overall simply need to be fired.
-They do not promote professional development or promote within so be prepared to feel burnt out and over your position within the first year.
-Upper management are bullies.
advice_to_mgmt: Hire a new HR team. Create an atmosphere where all of your employees feel appreciated and feel like they have a chance to grow within the organization. Stop playing favoritism. Figure out if you're a media center, babysitting program or TV network.

cons: It would be good if the hours we consistent but it's on a as needed basis.
